page.title: 12Local News 1985
page.content: Cheese Shop opens - selling 25 diferent varieties. The cheeses, butter and cream are all made in te local cheese factory. They also export cheese to America. Rooke's Pottery - opens, both making and selling their own pots. They also have pots exported to America as well as outlets in Britain. A New House - is born just across the road from the school. It is a modern detached house. The owners are imigrating from Canada to live here, their names - Mr and Mrs Beattie. News Extra - Annual Antiques Fair raised Â£281 for school funds. Toy and Book Fair held at school organised by Caroline Waring and Marie Pegg age 11 raised Â£45 for Doctor Barnados. School Cook - retires after 20 years. Mrs Deavile presented with Â£100 cheque, donations from villagers.
